title: Statue base for Hieron II of Syracuse

provenanceFound._: The baseappears to have been found in Acradina in 1734. Lupi 1734, the first published notice, merely refers to it as a 'basis nuper inventa Syracusis'. However, a fuller account of Lupi is provided in Schiavo 1756 (vol.1.5, p.17), stating that it was found in 1734 in the modern suburbs of Syracusa but within the ancient walls. This is in turn formulated as the part of Acradina close to the two ports of the city in the epigraphic 'Raccolta' of Cesare Gaetani (Syracusan antiquarian, 1718-1808, the manuscript compiled 1772-1784).

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2006-04; 2013-10-02; 2016-06-28, in magazzino C of the Museo archeologico

graphics.desc: Photo J. Prag, Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
